text: Sir Alfred Charles Bernard Lovell (31 August 19136 August 2012) was an English physicist and radio astronomer. He was the first Director of Jodrell Bank Observatory, from 1945 to 1980. Lovell is mostly known for his works in astronomy. Lovell was knighted in 1961, later becoming "Sir". ==Early Life== Lovell was born on August 31, 1913 in Oldland Common, Bristol, England to Gilbert and to Luara Lovell. Lovell was educated at King's Oak Academy. Lovell was never married and had no children. ===Death=== Lovell died on August 6, 2012 in Swettenham, Cheshire, England from natural causes, he was just 25 days short from his 99th birthday, he was 98 years old. ==References== ==Other websites== * Bernard Lovell telling his life story at Web of Stories Category:1913 births Category:2012 deaths Category:English astronomers Category:Knights Bachelor Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:English physicians Category:People from Bristol
